section.title: Basic Operations
section.para: Stratego does not have the normal mathematical syntax for the arithmetic operators +, -, / and *. The syntax for these operators are reserved for other purposes. Instead, the library provides the operators as the strategies add, subt, div and mul. Further, there are two convenience functions for integer increment, inc and decrement, dec.

There is a distinction between real numbers and integer numbers throughout the library. Arithmetic strategies which work on real numbers end in an r, e.g. addr, and strategies working on integers end in an i, e.g. subti. For each arithmetic operator, there is also a type-promoting variant, e.g. mul, which will type-promote from integer to real, when necessary. Additionally, the arithmetic operations also work on strings containing integers, e.g divS. All these variants are shown below.
